sentences.sContent: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.sContent_eng: If you or your partner criticise each other habitually, you are attacking their personality.
sentences.sCn: 如果你或你的伴侣习惯性地批评对方，其实你们是在攻击对方的人格。

sentences.sContent: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.sContent_eng: The more we criticise a nation in motion the less we have to say about our own sad lost little island.
sentences.sCn: 我们对运转中的国家的批评越多，我们就能更少地谈到我们所在的迷失的小岛。

sentences.sContent: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.sContent_eng: These papers found it to their advantage, during the unpopularity of Darling, to criticise severely the acts of that Governor, who was defended by the Gazette with intemperate zeal.
sentences.sCn: 这两份报纸发现，基于达令总督的不得人心，他们拥有一大优势：严词批评总督的法令，和《公报》的过分阿谀拍马对着干。
